title: Belmopan
page_copy: Listen to radio stations from Belmopan, from a wide variety of genres like Adult Contemporary, Dance, Hits, News and Top 40.  Enjoy stations such as More FM, Mixeology Radio, My Refuge Christian Radio and more.  Come find the top new songs, playlists, and music!  Listen on your iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch, Android, Blackberry, and other app-enabled mobile phones.

radio_info.short: n May 2000 More FM commenced operation with an official inauguration on January 29, 2001 at then existing Villanueva Broadcast Center in Belmopan. More FM's
radio_info.rest:
mission is:

"To provide the Belizean youths with a voice that reflects their needs and concerns in a positive way through their language and music and instill values by creating positive awareness and action on the role they play in the forming of our society and building of our nation.

Programming will include shows hosted by young people who will present the issue from a youth's perspective. The station will provide positive entertainment for Belize's youths and become involved in all aspects of youth development in our country by affiliating itself with various youth groups and projects"

After operating from Belmopan for 4yrs, More FM was relocated to the RSV Media Center on Slaughterhouse Road, where it presently operates from.

radio_info.short: Started in 1994, My Refuge Christian Ministries is a "not-for-profit" corporation under Chapter 206 of the laws of Belize. Our goal is to reach the
radio_info.rest:
families of Belize in order to reach the nation. This is done through counseling, family activities, youth programs, community initiatives, Christian media presentations and special activities (concerts, banquets etc).

The original ministry outreach of My Refuge Christian Ministries was My Refuge Christian Radio, which continues to operate on 93.7FM in the capital city and outlying areas. In September 2004, 100.5FM in Belize City started broadcasting. Since July 2009, My Refuge Ministries networks with Plus TV on a 1 hour TV show called eyes on the nation.

My Refuge has extended its outreach to include HIV support ministry, married couples ministry and church networking activities. In addition, we work to link ministries to people and people to ministries. For more information on each of these outreaches, please visit their respective pages on this site

radio_info.short: The desire for a local Christian radio station was often expressed by the people of Spanish Lookout, and by Isaac Dueck, who eventually saw his
radio_info.rest: dream unfold by the grace of God. “My hopes for a Christian Radio Station was for it to provide beautiful, inspiring praise and worship music, as well as solid Bible teaching that would positively minister to the people of Belize.”
